item.name: üç™ Cookie Management

request.description:
**Basic Cookie Example** üç™

Sets a basic user preference cookie with:
- **Name**: `user_preference`
- **Value**: `dark_mode`
- **Max Age**: 7 days
- **HttpOnly**: false (JavaScript accessible)
- **Path**: `/`

### What This Demonstrates:
- Simple cookie creation
- User preference storage
- Client-side accessible data

### Check After Request:
1. **Postman Cookies Tab**: See the new cookie
2. **Headers**: Look for `Set-Cookie` header
3. **Browser Dev Tools**: Application ‚Üí Cookies

### Real-World Use Cases:
- Theme preferences (dark/light mode)
- Language settings
- UI preferences (sidebar collapsed/expanded)

**Secure Cookie Example** üîí

Sets a secure authentication cookie with:
- **Name**: `auth_token`
- **Value**: `secure_token_12345`
- **HttpOnly**: true (XSS protection)
- **Secure**: true (HTTPS only)
- **SameSite**: strict (CSRF protection)
- **Max Age**: 1 hour
- **Signed**: true (integrity verification)

### Security Features:
- **HttpOnly**: Prevents JavaScript access (XSS protection)
- **Secure**: Only transmitted over HTTPS
- **SameSite**: Prevents cross-site request attacks
- **Signed**: Ensures cookie integrity

### Real-World Use Cases:
- Authentication tokens
- CSRF tokens
- Session identifiers
- Sensitive user data

**Tracking Cookies Example** üìà

Sets analytics and tracking cookies:
- **visit_count**: Incremental counter
- **last_visit**: Timestamp of visit
- **Max Age**: 30 days
- **HttpOnly**: false (allows JavaScript access)

### What This Demonstrates:
- Visit counting and tracking
- Timestamp storage
- Long-term data persistence
- Analytics implementation

### Run Multiple Times:
Try calling this endpoint several times to see the visit counter increment!

### Real-World Use Cases:
- User analytics
- Visit tracking
- Behavior analysis
- A/B testing data

**Shopping Cart Cookie** üõí

Implements shopping cart using cookies:
- Stores cart data as JSON in cookie
- Adds random products on each call
- **Max Age**: 7 days
- **Size Limit**: ~4KB total

### What This Demonstrates:
- JSON data storage in cookies
- Persistent shopping cart
- Cookie size limitations
- Client-side data management

### Try This:
1. Call this endpoint multiple times
2. See cart items accumulate
3. Check cookie size in dev tools
4. Compare with session-based cart later

### Pros & Cons:
‚úÖ **Pros**: Persists across sessions, no server storage  
‚ùå **Cons**: Size limited, sent with every request

**Cookie Reading Demo** üìñ

Reads and displays all current cookies:
- Shows all cookie names and values
- Displays cookie sizes and statistics
- Educational information about cookies
- Security considerations

### Best Time to Use:
After setting some cookies with the previous endpoints!

### What You'll See:
- Complete cookie inventory
- Size analysis
- Security information
- Browser compatibility notes

### Learning Points:
- How cookies are transmitted
- Size impact on requests
- Security implications

**Cookie Cleanup** üßπ

Clears non-authentication cookies:
- `user_preference`
- `visit_count`
- `last_visit`
- `shopping_cart`

### What This Demonstrates:
- Selective cookie deletion
- Cookie lifecycle management
- Preserving important cookies (auth tokens)

### Security Note:
Notice that authentication cookies are NOT cleared - this is a security best practice for partial cleanup operations.

**Authentication Logout** üö™

Clears authentication-related cookies:
- `auth_token`
- Other sensitive authentication data

### What This Demonstrates:
- Secure logout process
- Authentication cookie cleanup
- Security best practices

### Use Case:
This simulates what happens when a user logs out - only authentication cookies are cleared while user preferences might remain.

item.description: Learn about cookies - client-side storage that's sent with every HTTP request. Explore security options, size limitations, and practical use cases.

item.name: üíæ Session Management

request.description:
**Session Initialization** üé¨

Creates a new user session with:
- **User data**: ID, name, email, role
- **Preferences**: theme, language, notifications
- **Visit tracking**: count and timestamp
- **Login time**: authentication timestamp

### What This Demonstrates:
- Server-side data storage
- Complex object storage
- Session initialization
- User authentication state

### What Happens:
1. Session ID is generated (stored in cookie)
2. User data is stored server-side
3. Visit counter is initialized
4. Login timestamp is recorded

### Security Benefits:
- Data not visible to client
- No size limitations
- Cannot be tampered with
- Server-controlled lifecycle

**Session Shopping Cart** üõí

Implements shopping cart using sessions:
- Stores complex cart data server-side
- Adds detailed product information
- Sets flash message for user feedback
- No size limitations

### What This Demonstrates:
- Server-side data storage
- Complex object handling
- Flash message integration
- Unlimited data capacity

### Compare With Cookie Cart:
Try this after using the cookie-based cart to see the differences in:
- Data complexity
- Storage capacity
- Security
- Performance

### Run Multiple Times:
Call this several times to build up a substantial cart, then compare with the cookie version!

**Flash Messages Setup** ‚ö°

Sets various types of flash messages:
- **Success**: Operation completed
- **Info**: Informational message  
- **Warning**: Warning message
- **Error**: Error message

### What This Demonstrates:
- Temporary message storage
- User feedback system
- One-time data persistence
- Message categorization

### Important:
Flash messages are **consumed on first read**! After setting them here, immediately call the "Read Flash Messages" endpoint to see them before they disappear.

### Real-World Use Cases:
- Form submission feedback
- Error notifications
- Success confirmations
- User guidance messages

**User Preferences Update** ‚öôÔ∏è

Updates user preferences in session:
- Toggles theme (dark ‚Üî light)
- Updates timestamp
- Sets success flash message
- Requires existing user session

### What This Demonstrates:
- Session data modification
- User preference management
- Data persistence
- Flash message feedback

### Prerequisites:
Run "Initialize User Session" first!

### Try This:
1. Initialize session first
2. Call this endpoint multiple times
3. Watch theme toggle between dark/light
4. Note the success flash messages

**Session ID Regeneration** üîÑ

Regenerates the session ID for security:
- Creates new session ID
- Preserves all session data
- Sets informational flash message
- Security best practice

### What This Demonstrates:
- Session security enhancement
- ID regeneration without data loss
- Security best practices
- Post-authentication procedures

### When to Use:
- After user login
- After privilege escalation
- Periodically for security
- After sensitive operations

### Security Benefit:
Prevents session fixation attacks by ensuring the session ID changes after authentication.

**Session Cart Cleanup** üßπ

Clears shopping cart from session:
- Removes cart data
- Removes cart timestamp
- Sets success flash message
- Preserves other session data

### What This Demonstrates:
- Selective session data removal
- Partial session cleanup
- User feedback via flash messages
- Data lifecycle management

### Use Case:
Simulates user clearing their cart or completing a purchase while keeping their login session active.

**User Logout** üö™

Simulates user logout by clearing:
- User authentication data
- Visit tracking data
- Shopping cart data
- All user-specific information
- Sets logout flash message

### What This Demonstrates:
- Comprehensive logout process
- Security data cleanup
- Proper session management
- User feedback

### Security Practice:
This shows how to properly clear sensitive data on logout while maintaining the session for flash messages.

**Complete Session Destruction** üí•

Completely destroys the session:
- Removes ALL session data
- Destroys session ID
- Creates entirely new session
- Nuclear option for cleanup

### What This Demonstrates:
- Complete session lifecycle
- Total data cleanup
- Security reset
- Fresh start capability

### When to Use:
- Security breaches
- Complete user logout
- Session corruption
- Administrative cleanup

### Note:
After this, you'll need to initialize a new session to continue testing!

**Session Data Reading** üìñ

Reads and displays current session:
- Session ID and metadata
- User authentication state
- Cart information
- Visit statistics
- Flash messages (consumed after reading!)

### What This Demonstrates:
- Session data inspection
- Current session state
- Data organization
- Flash message consumption

### Best Used After:
- Initializing session
- Setting flash messages
- Modifying session data
- Before session cleanup

item.name: ‚öñÔ∏è Comparison & Educational

request.description:
**Comprehensive Comparison** üîç

Provides detailed comparison between cookies and sessions:
- **Storage location** differences
- **Data transmission** patterns
- **Size limitations** comparison
- **Security** implications
- **Performance** considerations
- **Current data** from both approaches

### What This Demonstrates:
- Side-by-side comparison
- Real-world trade-offs
- When to use each approach
- Current state analysis

### Best Used After:
- Setting up both cookies and sessions
- Adding items to both cookie and session carts
- Understanding both approaches

### Educational Value:
This endpoint provides the "why" behind choosing cookies vs sessions for different use cases.

**Shopping Cart Deep Dive** üõí

Detailed comparison of cookie vs session shopping carts:
- **Current cart contents** from both approaches
- **Storage method** analysis
- **Pros and cons** of each approach
- **Recommendations** for different scenarios
- **Architecture patterns** for enterprise

### What This Demonstrates:
- Practical implementation comparison
- Real-world decision factors
- Scalability considerations
- Hybrid approaches

### Prerequisites:
For best results, add items to both:
1. Cookie cart: `/demo/cookies/shopping-cart`
2. Session cart: `/demo/sessions/shopping-cart`

### Learning Focus:
Understand when to choose cookies vs sessions for e-commerce applications.

**Flash Messages Consumer** ‚ö°

Reads and consumes flash messages:
- Displays all current flash messages
- **Automatically clears** messages after reading
- Explains flash message lifecycle
- Shows common use cases

### What This Demonstrates:
- Flash message consumption
- One-time data concept
- User feedback patterns
- Message lifecycle

### Important Timing:
1. First call `/demo/sessions/flash` to set messages
2. Then immediately call this endpoint
3. Call this endpoint again - messages will be gone!

### Real-World Pattern:
This simulates how flash messages work in web applications - perfect for form submission feedback.
